result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dereono Lewis-Merriweather not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey William Jensen in court for Dereono Lewis-Merriweather.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has another pending matter and parties are pursuing a global resolution. Court authorizes transfer to Branch 28 for resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeffrey William Jensen in court, defendant Dereono Lewis-Merriweather not in court, in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defendant has another pending matter in Branch 28.  Defense requests a status date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Due to court availability case is rescheduled. Parties notified.

Defendant Dereono Lewis-Merriweather in court with Attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Defendant Dereono Lewis-Merriweather in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Letter from defendant.  (Dereono Lewis-Merriweather - #2022005214, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Dereono Lewis-Merriweather not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dereono Lewis-Merriweather not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Dereono Lewis-Merriweather in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Dereono Lewis-Merriweather in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dereono Lewis-Merriweather appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Case retabbed due to nature of case.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
